intro: Ixyophora carinata, commonly known as the ridge-stemmed milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, ribbed stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically arranged in terminal inflorescences. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Ixyophora carinata is known for its milky sap, which is a common feature among plants in the Asclepiadaceae family.
